description:
Essential Duties and Responsibilities Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing and Market Access teams to incorporate key business drive and sales directives into learning objectives that will maximize sales force effectiveness Support the development and execution of relevant, effective training objectives, content, resources and processes to advance product and technical knowledge as well as meet brand and performance needs Manage the onboarding process including content, curriculum, calendars and resources to provide appropriate training and onboarding of new hires Deliver timely updates to learning curriculum and training materials by identifying ongoing training needs and objectives Partner with Sales Leadership to identify needs and opportunities for pull-through, follow-up, and / or coaching opportunities Conduct field-based co-travels to reinforce selling strategies, tools, resources and evaluate performance effectiveness Support efforts towards coaching and development that include professional development, training resources and learning opportunities for sales and other internal teams Support the development and facilitation of content for training programs Facilitate presentations to senior management, sales organization and other internal teams Coordinate vendor management to execute training objectives while successfully managing timelines, budgets and effective working relationships Manage appropriate Promotional Review Committee (PRC) process to meet timing and distribution of projects Requirements Bachelor's degree in related field from an accredited 4 year college or university 5
years' sales experience with a proven track record of successful sales performance in the biotech / pharmaceutical industry 2
years of experience in a home-office based sales training role Experience launching new products Demonstrates success in developing and executing effective strategic training plans including multi-phase learning and comprehensive curriculum Ability to effectively develop and deliver impactful training presentations and workshops to engage cross-functional teams, stakeholders and diverse audiences with measurable results Clear track record of managing multiple projects involving cross-functional stakeholders and business objectives Advanced communication (written / verbal), presentation and interpersonal skills to interact with varied department, management and audience levels Advanced knowledge of best-in-class learning approaches and techniques using diverse strategies Ability to work effectively as an individual contributor and as part of a team is essential. Proficiency in identifying learning needs, formulate training plans and execute appropriate strategies Advanced organizational, prioritization and business planning abilities; ability to manage multiple tasks, responsibilities and timelines Advanced computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint Able to travel up to 30% including overnights for field-based co-travels and attendance at Training programs, Sales Meetings and Company events Preferred Experience Advanced business and / or life science degree Rare disease experience
